definition: to freeze/to feel very cold/aspic or jelly

sentences.english: Someone brought cold cuts, dark bread, and beer from the jeep.
sentences.chinese: 有人把吉普车上的冻肉，黑面包和啤酒送上来。

sentences.english: Thaw out the frozen meat before cooking.

屠夫砍下一块冻肉的肋条。

sentences.english: Leo: Yes, this just looks like a piece of frozen meat from fridge.
sentences.chinese: 是啊，这块就像是刚从冰箱拿出来的冻肉。

sentences.english: Yes, this just looks like a piece of frozen meat from fridge.

sentences.english: Frozen coral garoupa filet is available in most super markets or frozen meat shops.
sentences.chinese: 急冻东星鱼柳可于大超级市场或大冻肉公司购买。

sentences.english: The butcher chopped off a rib of frozen pork.
Also in deep frozen meat and smoked ham, the virus is able to survive.
sentences.chinese: 所以在冻肉和熏火腿中，病毒仍然可以存活。

sentences.english: Frozen meat is sliced deli-thin to prepare it for hot pot cooking.
sentences.chinese: 冻肉切片得力是超薄准备为锅做饭。

sentences.english: She thawed out the frozen meat in the microwave oven.
sentences.chinese: 她用微波炉将冻肉化开。

sentences.english: Pick up some cold meat from the 5)deli.
